alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:20PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnson County through 800 PM EDT... At 719 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Reese, or near Mountain City, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mountain City, Doeville and Neva. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
